definition: to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.english: If more money comes in, Nalanda will use it to repair the leaking roof of the old building.
sentences.chinese: 供養金若超過所需，餘額即將用以修葺舊舍屋頂。

sentences.english: To cater to them, many of the old lodges have been revamped.
sentences.chinese: 爲了迎合遊客的需求，許多門面又被重新修葺了。

sentences.english: Old dwellings are gradually falling apart not to be repaired or replaced.
sentences.chinese: 沒有修葺或者沒被取代的老房子漸漸被隔離開來。

sentences.english: The pavilions beside the lake have an air of great antiquity.
sentences.chinese: 湖邊的亭閣被修葺得古色古香。

sentences.english: The citizens are repairing the city walls.
sentences.chinese: 城裏的居民正在修葺城郭。

sentences.english: Connect over yard advice or repairs that need cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 對院子的佈置和修葺等需要合作精神的工作提出建議。

sentences.english: Up to 1983 the municipal government began to carry out repairs to the Lotus Temple.
sentences.chinese: 直至一九八三年市政府纔開始對芙蓉寺進行修葺。

sentences.english: The original legislation in the river flood the monument has been Chongdao, has yet to repair.
sentences.chinese: 原來在河邊立的碑石已被洪水衝倒，至今還沒有修葺。

sentences.english: The villagers spontaneously donated more than 10,000 RMB for the materials to have the well completely restored.
sentences.chinese: 村民們自發捐了一萬多元買材料，將水井修葺一新。

sentences.english: LeiGang when volunteers for the church to repair, he is more snow Joe share my pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 雷剛當義工替教堂修葺，他更向雪喬分享本人的高興。

sentences.english: All three of Saan's ships had been in dire need of 'refitting, but by now the work should be complete.
sentences.chinese: 其中桑恩的三艘都亟需大修，不過目前應已修葺完畢。

sentences.english: They contacted Keller, who by then had gone home to deal with a worker doing repairs to her house.
sentences.chinese: 他們聯繫了當時已經回家安排修葺房屋工人的凱勒。

definition: to repair/to refurbish/to renovate/to refit/to mend/to rebuild
to reconstruct/to repair/to revamp/to revise/to retake a failed course
to carry out large scale construction
to extend (a building, an airport runway etc)
(literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)
